ad-blocking-tasks.title: No long tasks seem to block ad-related network requests
ad-blocking-tasks.failureTitle: Long tasks are blocking ad-related network requests
ad-blocking-tasks.description: Tasks blocking the main thread can delay the ad related resources, consider removing long blocking tasks or moving them off the main thread with web workers. These tasks can be especially detrimental to performance on less powerful devices. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#long-tasks)

ad-request-critical-path.title: Minimize critical path for loading ad requests
ad-request-critical-path.failureTitle: Long critical path for loading ad requests
ad-request-critical-path.description: These are the resources that block the first ad request. Consider reducing the number of resources or improving their execution to start loading ads as soon as possible. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#blocking-resouces)

ad-request-from-page-start.title: Latency of first ad request (from page start)
ad-request-from-page-start.failureTitle: Reduce latency of first ad request (from page start)
ad-request-from-page-start.description: This measures the time for the first ad request to be made relative to the page load starting. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#measurements)

ad-request-from-tag-load.title: Latency of first ad request (from tag load)
ad-request-from-tag-load.failureTitle: Reduce latency of first ad request (from tag load)
ad-request-from-tag-load.description: This measures the time for the first ad request to be made relative to the Google Publisher Tag loading. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#measurements)

ad-top-of-viewport.title: Ads are below top of viewport
ad-top-of-viewport.failureTitle: Top ad is too high in viewport
ad-top-of-viewport.description: Over 10% of ads are never viewed due to the user scrolling past before the ad is visible. By moving ads away from the very top of the viewport, the likelihood of the ad being scrolled past prior to load is decreased  and the ad is more likely to be viewed. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#top-of-viewport)
ad-top-of-viewport.failureDisplayValue: A scroll of %i px would hide half of your topmost ad

ads-in-viewport.title: Few or no ads loaded outside viewport
ads-in-viewport.failureTitle: There are eager ads loaded outside viewport
ads-in-viewport.description: Too many ads loaded outside the viewport lowers viewability rates and impact user experience, consider loading ads below the fold lazily as the user scrolls down. Consider using GPT's [Lazy Loading API](https://developers.google.com/doubleclick-gpt/reference#googletag.PubAdsService_enableLazyLoad). [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#eager-ads)

async-ad-tags.title: GPT tag is loaded asynchronously
async-ad-tags.description: Loading the GPT tag synchronously blocks all content rendering until the tag is fetched and evaluated, consider using the `async` attribute for the GPT tag to ensure it is loaded asynchronously. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#async-tags)

duplicate-tags.title: No duplicate tags are loaded in any frame
duplicate-tags.failureTitle: There are duplicate tags loaded in the same frame
duplicate-tags.description: Loading a tag more than once in the same frame is redundant and adds overhead without benefit. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#duplicate-tags)

full-width-slots.title: Slots are utilizing most of the viewport width
full-width-slots.failureTitle: Slots are not utilizing the full viewport width
full-width-slots.description: Have ad slot sizes that utilize most of the viewport's width to increase CTR. We recommend leaving no more than 25% of the viewport's width unutilized. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#full-width-slots)

idle-network-times.title: [Experimental] Minimize network idle time before ad requests
idle-network-times.failureTitle: [Experimental] High network idle time before ad requests
idle-network-times.description: High network idle times indicate that there are opportunities to speed up ad loading by utiilizing the network effectively. Network idle times can be caused by long tasks, timeouts, waiting on load events, or render blocking resources
idle-network-times.displayValue: %s ms spent idle in critical path

loads-gpt-over-https.title: Uses HTTPS to load GPT
loads-gpt-over-https.description: For privacy and security always load GPT over HTTPS. With insecure pages explicitly request the GPT script securely. Example:`<script async="async" src="https://www.googletagservices.com/tag/js/gpt.js">`. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#https)

script-injected-tags.title: Avoid script injected tags in the main document
script-injected-tags.failureTitle: Found script injected tags in the main document
script-injected-tags.description: Prefer loading scripts using `<script async>` instead of injecting script tags with JavaScript. Doing so lets the browser to request scripts earlier. [Learn more.](https://www.igvita.com/2014/05/20/script-injected-async-scripts-considered-harmful/)

serial-header-bidding.title: No serial header bidding detected
serial-header-bidding.failureTitle: There are serial header bidding requests
serial-header-bidding.description: Running header bidding serially make ads load slower, which has an impact on impressions. Consider running in parallel. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#serial-header-bidding)

static-ad-tags.title: GPT tag is loaded statically
static-ad-tags.description: Tags loaded dynamically are not visible to the browser preloader, consider using a static tag or `<link rel="preload">`. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#dynamic-tag)

tag-load-time.title: Tag load time
tag-load-time.description: This measures the time for the Google Publisher Tag's implementation script (pubads_impl.js) to load after the page loads. [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#measurements)

viewport-ad-density.title: Ad density inside viewport is within recommended range
viewport-ad-density.failureTitle: Ad density inside viewport is higher than recommended
viewport-ad-density.description: The ads-to-content ratio inside the viewport can have an impact on user experience and ultimately user retention. The Better Ads Standard [recommends having an ad density below 30%](https://www.betterads.org/mobile-ad-density-higher-than-30/). [Learn more.](https://ad-speed-insights.appspot.com/#ad-density)

NOT_APPLICABLE.NO_VALID_AD_WIDTHS: No requested ads contain ads of valid width

ERRORS.AREA_LARGER_THAN_VIEWPORT: Calculated ad area is larger than viewport
